skshapelet.utils package¶

Submodules¶

skshapelet.utils.TimeSeries module¶

class skshapelet.utils.TimeSeries.TimeSeries(id, label, len=0, inv_cov=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class to describe time series behaviours.

Attributes:
id: int

The index of the time series dataset.

label: int

The label of the time series.

len: int, optional

The length of the time series.

inv_cov: ndarray, optional

Inverse covariance matrix related to the time series.

skshapelet.utils.scheduler module¶

skshapelet.utils.scheduler.round_robin(*iterables)[source]¶

The round robin scheduler. This mirrors the sktime implementation.

Attributes:
iterables: list

The index with a dist (each class with its own instance ids)

Returns:
output: list

Return a list of time series index.

skshapelet.utils.timer module¶

class skshapelet.utils.timer.State(value)[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

The status for the timer. This class is inherited from Enum.

Attributes:
activate: int

Let the timer engine start.

deactivate: int

The timer shutdown its engine.

activate = 1¶
deactivate = 0¶
class skshapelet.utils.timer.Timer(countdown=inf)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class to describe timer behaviours.

Attributes:
state: int

The status of the timer.

start_time: int

When the timer starts to work. The number is presented by second.

countdown: int, optional

The minutes for the countdown.

skshapelet.utils.validation module¶

skshapelet.utils.validation.check_min_instances(arr)[source]¶

Check the array has a suitable size.

Args:
arr: pandas DataFrame

The array that needs to be tested.

Returns:
output: bool

The instance length requirement check result.

skshapelet.utils.validation.check_min_length(require_len, actual_len)[source]¶

Check the instance has a suitable size.

Args:
require_len: int

The required instance length.

actual_len: int

The real instance length.

Returns:
output: int

The minimum length of the instance.

skshapelet.utils.validation.check_transform_X(X_list)[source]¶

Returns X that has been transformed into numpy arrays. This mirrors the sktime implementation.

Args:
X_list: pandas DataFrame

The array is presented by pandas.

Returns:
X_list: ndarray

The array is presented by numpy.

skshapelet.utils.validation.check_transform_series(X_list, y)[source]¶

Returns X, y that have been transformed into numpy arrays. This mirrors the sktime implementation.

Args:
X_list: pandas DataFrame

The array is presented by pandas.

y: pandas DataFrame

The array is presented by pandas.

Returns:
output: ndarray, ndarray

The array is presented by numpy.

skshapelet.utils.validation.check_transform_y(y)[source]¶

Returns y that has been transformed into numpy arrays.

Args:
y: pandas DataFrame

The array is presented by pandas.

Returns:
y: ndarray

The array is presented by numpy.
